update.description: A collision element should now return the correct bounding box.
update.title: Fix bounding boxes for collisions (#1146)

update.description: A collision element should now return the correct bounding box.
update.title: Fix bounding boxes for collisions (#1146)

content.raw: Thanks, we should be consistent. We can address that with issue #1125.
content.html: Thanks, we should be consistent. We can address that with issue #1125.

content.raw:
Looks like Entity's `GetCollisionBoundingBox()` returns the box in world coordinates but Visual's `GetBoundingBox()` returns local coordinates as found in issue #1125. We should keep them consistent. 

As an example, OGRE uses `getBoundingBox()` and `getWorldBoundingBox()` to distinguish between the two. We can continue this discussion in issue #1125 but I just wanted to bring it up.
content.html:
Looks like Entity's GetCollisionBoundingBox() returns the box in world coordinates but Visual's GetBoundingBox() returns local coordinates as found in issue #1125. We should keep them consistent.

As an example, OGRE uses getBoundingBox() and getWorldBoundingBox() to distinguish between the two. We can continue this discussion in issue #1125 but I just wanted to bring it up.

content.raw: A part from Ian's comment, it is working fine for me.
content.html: A part from Ian's comment, it is working fine for me.

This function now just looks very similar to GetCollisionBoundingBoxHelper. Looks like the code can be simplified, see below. Test passes. 

  BasePtr base = boost::const_pointer_cast<Base>(shared_from_this());
  return this->GetCollisionBoundingBoxHelper(base);

content.raw: Ok. It seemed like an easy way to get a few more tests without duplicating code. I'll make an integration test in my branch.
content.html: Ok. It seemed like an easy way to get a few more tests without duplicating code. I'll make an integration test in my branch.

content.raw: The regression should be limited in scope. We can test all the physics engines in an integration test. I'll leave the regression test as it stands.
content.html: The regression should be limited in scope. We can test all the physics engines in an integration test. I'll leave the regression test as it stands.

content.raw: I filed #1148 and disabled the failing tests in d2b775ea0872. Please consider merging with my branch (issue_1146_scpeters) to get the expanded test.
content.html: I filed #1148 and disabled the failing tests in d2b775ea0872. Please consider merging with my branch (issue_1146_scpeters) to get the expanded test.

update.description: A collision element should now return the correct bounding box.
update.title: Fix bounding boxes for collisions (#1146)

content.raw: It would be helpful to have more than the issue number in the pull request title. There's currently 3 pull requests with just issue numbers in the title, and it's hard for me to remember which is which.
content.html: It would be helpful to have more than the issue number in the pull request title. There's currently 3 pull requests with just issue numbers in the title, and it's hard for me to remember which is which.

update.description: A collision element should now return the correct bounding box.
update.title: Fix for issue #1146

content.raw:
You're moving the object up off the ground_plane and then expecting the bounding box to be in a certain location, but the simulation isn't paused. It seems like a race condition to me.

You could disable gravity or pause the simulation to fix it.
content.html:
You're moving the object up off the ground_plane and then expecting the bounding box to be in a certain location, but the simulation isn't paused. It seems like a race condition to me.

You could disable gravity or pause the simulation to fix it.
